alert.note: Alert for Mason; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF MASON AND ROBERTSON COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 412 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Fairview, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Maysville, Washington, Aberdeen, Lewisburg, Mount Olivet, Sardis, Blue Licks Battlefield, Murphysville, Burika, Alhambra, Mays Lick, Mitchells Mill, Rectorville, Peed, Helena, Piqua, US Route 62 at State Route 875, Abigail, Mount Gilead and Fleming-Mason Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for northern Kentucky. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northern and northeastern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
